availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Deppen (Louisville, Kentucky, clothing merchant and trustee.)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, clothing merchant and trustee. Native of Prussia. Married to Mary Rosalia Weyd Deppen in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on April 19, 1842. Father of Mary Theresa Deppen, Louis G. Deppen, Charles Deppen, Henry Deppen, William Deppen, and Julia Deppen. Clothing merchant in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Clothing merchant in Louisville in 1860. Trustee of the Ohio and Kentucky Petroleum Mining Company in Louisville in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 7, p. 356B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 7, 356B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 8, 91A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000817883.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 32617.
"Ohio and Kentucky Petroleum & Mining Company," Courier-Journal, (Louisville, KY), 17 Feb 1865.
"Henry Deppen (1816-1879)," Find A Grave, Memorial 190533211, accessed May 17, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/190533211.
